get.description:
There are three possibilities to search for gas stations. If you want to search in a specific radius around a given longitude and latitude you have to provide the following query parameters:

* latitude (required)
* longitude (required)
* radius (required)
* accuracy (optional)

If you want to search in a given bounding box you have to provide the following query parameters:

* boundingBox (required)

If you want to search along a given path you have to provide the following query parameters:
* path (required)
* radius (required)

If you have map-matched GPS data you can also provide a `deviation` query parameter. By using this query type, the evaluation if the user is inside the polygon of a specific location-based PACE app needs to be done by the client.

parameters.name: filter[poiType]
parameters.description: POI type you are searching for (in this case gas stations)

parameters.name: filter[appType]
parameters.description: Search only gas stations with fueling app available

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Include boolean field `insideAppArea` to response indicating that we are inside an app's area

parameters.name: filter[deviation]
parameters.description: Deviation in case of map-matched GPS data

parameters.name: filter[boundingBox]
parameters.description: Bounding box representing left, bottom, right, top. The query parametes need to be passed 4 times in exactly the order left, bottom, right, top.

attributes.title: PACE Fueling App
attributes.subtitle: Zahle bargeldlos mit der PACE Fueling App

attributes.title: PACE Fueling App
attributes.subtitle: Zahle bargeldlos mit der PACE Fueling App

post.description: Get a list of map tiles in the Protobuf binary wire format.

get.summary: Returns a paginated list of sources
get.description: Returns a paginated list of sources optionally filtered by poi type and/or name

parameters.name: filter[poitype]
parameters.description: Filter for poi type, no filter returns all types

parameters.name: filter[name]
parameters.description: Filter for all sources with given source name

get.summary: Returns a paginated list of policies
get.description: Returns a paginated list of policies optionally filtered by poi type and/or country id and/or user id

parameters.name: filter[poiType]
parameters.description: Filter for poi type, no filter returns all types

parameters.name: filter[countryId]
parameters.description: Filter for all policies for the given country

parameters.name: filter[userId]
parameters.description: Filter for all policies created by the given user

get.description: Returns a list of eventsoptionally filtered by poi type and/or country id and/or user id

parameters.name: filter[sourceId]
parameters.description: Filter for all events from given source id

parameters.name: filter[userId]
parameters.description: Filter for all events for the changes made by a given user

get.summary: Returns a paginated list of POIs
get.description: Returns a paginated list of POIs optionally filtered by type, appId and/or query

parameters.name: filter[type]
parameters.description: Filter for poi type, no filter returns all types

parameters.name: filter[appId]
parameters.description: Filter id for app id, no filter returns pois for all apps

patch.summary: Updates POI with specified id (only passed attributes will be updated)
patch.description: Returns POI with specified id (only passed attributes will be updated)

get.description:
These location-based PACE apps deliver additional services for PACE customers based on their current position.
You can (or should) trigger this whenever:
* A longer stand-still is detected
* The engine is turned off
* Every 5 seconds if the user "left the road"

Please note that calling this API is very cheap and can be done regularly.

parameters.name: filter[deviation]
parameters.description: Deviation in case of map-matched GPS data

get.summary: Returns a paginated list of apps
get.description: Returns a paginated list of apps optionally filtered by type and/or query

parameters.name: filter[type]
parameters.description: Filter for poi type, no filter returns all types

get.summary: Returns all POI relations for specified app id
get.description: Returns all POI relations for specified app id

patch.summary: Update all POI relations for specified app id
patch.description: Update all POI relations for specified app id

area.description: Once entered, a notification is sent

coordinates.description: Polygon coordinates with 4 or more positions. The first and last positions are equivalent (they represent equivalent points)

types.description: Filter for POI types contained in the push notification. An empty array indicates, that all POI types are allowed

ttl.description: TTL value for the subscription in minutes

subtitle.example: Zahle bargeldlos mit der PACE Fueling App

insideAppArea.description: Boolean flag if the current position is inside the app area (polygon).

countryCode.description: Country code in as specified in ISO 3166-1.

data.description: a JSON field containing POI specific data

metadata.description: a JSON field containing information about data field origin and update time

id.description: ID of the for the referenced object

createdAt.description: Time of POI creation in (iso8601 without zone - expects UTC)

timeToLive.description: Time to live in seconds (in relation to other entries)

schema.description: JSON field describing the structure of the updates sent by the data source

lastDataAt.description: timestamp of last import from source

CommonCountryId.description: Country this policy applies to (as ISO3166Alpha2)

Errors.description: Error objects provide additional information about problems encountered while performing an operation.

id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

about.description: A link that leads to further details about this particular occurrence of the problem.

status.description: the HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

code.description: an application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem that SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

detail.description: a human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. Like title, this fields value can be localized.

source.description: An object containing references to the source of the error.

pointer.description: A JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document [e.g. "/data" for a primary data object, or "/data/attributes/title" for a specific attribute].

parameter.description: A string indicating which URI query parameter caused the error.

meta.description: a meta object containing non-standard meta-information about the error.

BadRequest.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error

NotAcceptable.description: The specified Accept header is not valid

UnsupportedMediaType.description: The specified Content-Type header is not valid

UnprocessableEntity.description: Unprocessable entity, due to malformed or invalid json
